bullets.text: Powell signals readiness to cut rates as growth cools; intensifying Trump attacks raise risks to Fed independence.
Economists say Trump immigration curbs are shrinking the labor force, risking tighter labor markets, wage pressure, and slower growth.
Companies revive recession specials and heavy discounts, signaling weakening consumer demand and budget stress despite low unemployment.
Prospects of rate cuts and earnings rebound give small caps a chance to outperform the mega‑cap‑heavy S&P 500.
Retail inflows into speculative, niche ETFs may signal late‑cycle froth and rising market vulnerability.
Intel’s decline highlights incumbent risk in AI era; headline 'new' federal funding largely repackages previously awarded grants.
Tesla insiders reportedly sold over half their holdings this year, flashing potential confidence and valuation concerns.
Medtronic adds directors amid Elliott activism, signaling a push for operational improvements and shareholder value initiatives.
After a Gaza famine report, U.S. stays mostly silent while Israel remains defiant, underscoring continued Middle East instability.
OpenAI warns against unauthorized SPVs, highlighting opaque secondary fundraising risks and investor exposure around frontier‑AI access.
Researchers identify a long‑overlooked particle that could improve qubit control, advancing scalable quantum computing prospects.
A tiny human protein dismantles amyloid fibrils in vitro, suggesting new therapeutic avenues against Alzheimer’s pathology.
Sponge‑like materials in compact reactors boost fusion fueling and heat handling, inching fusion devices toward higher performance.
Engineered quantum dots enable room‑temperature, on‑chip quantum light sources, strengthening prospects for practical quantum‑secure communication.
Tailored pollen supplements restored missing nutrients, driving 15‑fold growth in bee colonies, with implications for crop pollination resilience.
